headline: Fight at Ohio GOP Senate debate elevates military issue
author: Associated Press
sentences: COLUMBUS, Ohio — A near-physical altercation in the nasty Republican primary for U.S. Senate in Ohio led to a demand Monday from some military veterans that one candidate apologize for his seeming insult, while the target of their request said he respects and honors the military but stands by his statement.
Mandel accused Gibbons of “making millions” off stock in a Chinese company, and Gibbons dismissively accused Mandel of not understanding how investments work.
The debate became intense almost as soon as it began as former state Treasurer Josh Mandel attacked investment banker Mike Gibbons’ business dealings.
The heated argument came during a debate Friday with five candidates running for the GOP nomination to replace the retiring Republican Sen.

“Don’t tell me I haven’t worked!”
“Back off, buddy, or you’re going to end up — ,” Gibbons told him, not finishing the sentence.

“You don’t know squat.”
“Two tours in Iraq,” Mandel shouted after rising from his seat.
Soon, the two were standing face to face on the debate stage, shouting at each other.
Democrats view the open seat as among their best chances to flip a seat nationally.
“You’ve never been in the private sector in your entire life,” Gibbons charged.
